Cpk Calculator is a free online tool that displays the process performance for the specified range. CoolGyan’S online Cpk calculator tool makes the calculation faster, and it calculates the performance of the process in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Cpk Calculator?

The procedure to use the Cpk calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the lower limit, upper limit, the mean and standard deviation in the input fields

Step 2: Now click the button “Calculate” to get the Cpk

Step 3: Finally, the process performance will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by Cpk?

In statistics, Cpk is a Process Capability Index which is used to measure the ability of the process in order to produce the output for the customer specification. Cpk gives the best scenario for the existing process and helps to estimate the future performance of the process. In simple words, Cpk is a tool which is used to estimate the producer capability to produce a product for the customer specification. The formula to calculate Cpk is given by:

Cpk = Min [(USL- Mean)/3σ, (Mean-LSL)/3σ]

Where,

USL  = Upper Specification Limit

LSL = Lower Specification Limit

What is Meant by Improper Integral?

In Calculus, improper integral also known as the definite integral, in which either or both the limits approach infinity. Also, the integrand also approaches infinity at one or more points in the integration range. The improper integrals can be computed using normal Riemann Integral. There are two types of improper integral. They are:

  • Both the limits a and b are infinite
  • f(x) has one or more discontinuity points in the interval [a, b]

data.post_title: Shadow Length Calculator - Online Free Calculator
data.post_description: Trigonometry helps to calculate the shadow of an object just by using the angle of elevation or the angle of depression.As the Sun rises , the shadows of the object is formed on the opposite side of the object facing the Sun.  The shadows are longer or shorter depending upon how high the Sun has climbed during the day.  Let us do a few problems on the shadow length calculator.
data.post_content:
Shadow length calculator is an essential online tool which calculates the length of the shadow projected by an object due to the Sun. The tool uses the angle of elevation to find the length of the shadow of an object. 

To calculate the shadow of an object, the angle of elevation is also required. The shadow length increase and decreases depending upon the time of the day. The shadow is formed on the opposite side and the following formula is used to calculate its length.

L = h/ tan α

Where,

  • L = Length of the shadow
  • h = height of the object
  • α = angle of elevation of the sun

Example on Shadow Length Calculation:

Consider a pole of length 10 m projecting a shadow. If the angle of elevation of the sun is 45° then, the length of the shadow will be,

L = 10/ tan 45°

Or, L = 10 m

Thus, when the sun’s elevation is 45°, the length of the object will be equal to the length of its shadow.

data.post_title: Area Between Two Curves Calculator - Online Calculator
data.post_description: Learn how to use the area between two curves calculator with the step-by-step procedure at CoolGyan’S. Also, get the standard form and FAQs online.
data.post_content:
The area between two curves calculator is a free online tool that gives the area occupied within two curves. CoolGyan’S online area between two curves calculator tool makes the calculations faster, and it displays the result in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Area Between Two Curves Calculator?

The procedure to use the area between the two curves calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the smaller function, larger function and the limit values in the given input fields

Step 2: Now click the button “Calculate Area” to get the output

Step 3: Finally, the area between the two curves will be displayed in the new window

What is the Area Between Two Curves?

The area between two curves can be determined by computing the difference between the definite integrals of two functions. In a two-dimensional geometry, the area is a quantity that expresses the region occupied by the two-dimensional figure. Two functions are required to find the area, say f(x) and g(x), and the integral limits from a to b (b should be greater than a) of the function, that represent the curve.

Standard Form

The standard formula to calculate the area between two curves is given as follows:

If P : y = f(x) and Q : y = g(x) and x1 and x2 are the two limits, then the formula is,

Area Between Two Curves, \(A = \int_{x_{1}}^{x_{2}}[f(x)-g(x)]\)

Frequently Asked Questions on Area Between Two Curves

What is the area between the two curves?

The area between the two curves is defined as the total region occupied between the two curves in the coordinate plane.

Can the area between the two curves be negative?

If both the curves lie under the x-axis, then the area between two curves will be negative. However, the net signed value is taken as the final answer.

How do you determine the area between the two curves?

The area between the two curves can be calculated by taking absolute difference of the definite integrals between the two functions.

data.post_content:
Find Basis Point

Basis Point calculator is a free online tool that gives the basis point for the given percentage change. CoolGyan’S online basis calculator tool makes the calculations faster and easier where it displays the basis point in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use Basis Point Calculator?

The procedure to use basis point calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the percentage change in the first input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Calculate Basis Point” to get the output

Step 3: The basis point will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by Basis Point?

Basis Point is a measurement unit for interest rates and percentages. This measurement unit is used to represent the percentage change in a financial instrument. Generally, one basis point equals 1/100th of 1%. It is also expressed as 0.01% or 0.0001. A basis point is abbreviated as “bp”, “bps”, or “bips”.

Standard Form

The relationship between basis point and the percentage change is summarized as follows:

1 % change = 100 Basis Point

0.01 % = 1 Basis Point

Frequently Asked Questions on Basis Point

What is meant by 50 Basis Points?

Since 1 Basis Point is equal to 0.01 %, 50 Basis point is equal to 0.5 percent.

Let B be a basis point

Therefore, B x 100 = 50

B = 50/100

B = 0.5

Therefore, 50 basis points denotes 0.5 percentage.

Why do we use Basis Point?

Basis Points are used to calculate the interest rates and percentage change. It is also used in trading to index the stocks.

Write the conversion between the basis point and percentage?

Conversion from basis point to Percentage: Divide the basis points by 100

Conversion from percentage to basis point = Multiply the percentage by 100.

data.post_title: Hour To Minute Calculator - Simple and Easy Online Calculator
data.post_description: The Hour To Minute Calculator is available here online for free, at CoolGyan'S. One hour is equal to sixty minutes. Learn to convert hours into minutes in an easy and simple way.
data.post_content:
Hour:
Minutes:

The Hour to Minute Calculator is an online tool that converts the value of time in an hour into its corresponding minutes’ value. CoolGyan’S Hour to Minute online converter calculator is a useful tool for primary school students, that makes calculations very simple and interesting for them.

1 hour = 60 minutes

1 hr = 60 min

Hour and Minutes

Hour and minutes are the units used to measure the time. One hour is equal to sixty minutes. But we can write minutes as a decimal number of hours. For example, half an hour (1/2 or 0.5 hour) cannot be written as 50 minutes. Half of an hour is equal to 30 minutes.

Similarly,

0.25 hour = 15 minutes

0.75 hour = 45 minutes

Hour can be written as hr and minute

Also,

1 hour = 60 minutes = 3600 seconds

1 hr = 60′ = 3600”

How to Convert Hour into Minutes?

To convert the value of time in the hour into the corresponding minutes, using calculator, follow the below steps:

Step 1: Mention the value of time (in hour) within the input field

Step 2: Click on ‘Solve’ button to get the result

Step 3: The converted value of time in minutes will appear in the output field

Solved Examples

Q.1: How to write one and half hours in minutes?

Solution: One and half hours can be written as 1.5 hours

Now, 1.5 hours = 1 hour + 0.5 hour

= 60 minutes + 30 minutes

= 90 minutes

Therefore, 1.5 hours = 90 minutes.

Q.2: What is the value of 4 hours in minutes?

Solution: 1 hour = 60 minutes

4 hours = 4 x 60 min

= 240 min

Thus, 4 hours = 240 minutes

How to convert Minutes to Hours?

To convert minutes into hours, we have to divide the number of minutes by 60. For example, 210 minutes can be converted to hours by dividing 210 by 60. This can be done as:

210 minutes = (210/60) hours 

= 21/6 hours

= 7/2 hours

= 3.5 hours

Therefore, 210 min = 3.5 hours.

data.post_title: Newtons Method Calculator - Free Online Calculator
data.post_description: Learn how to use the Newtons method calculator with a step-by-step procedure. Get the Newtons method calculator available online for free only at CoolGyan'S.
data.post_content:
Newton’s Method Calculator is a free online tool that displays better approximation to the roots of the real-valued function. CoolGyan’S online Newton’s method calculator tool performs the calculation faster, and it displays the approximation values in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use Newton’s Method Calculator? 

The procedure to use Newton’s method calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the initial value, function at an initial value, the first derivative of the function at the initial value in the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Submit” to get the result

Step 3: Finally, the approximation value will be displayed in the new window

What is Meant by Newton’s Method?

In Maths, Newton’s method is also known as the Newton- Raphson Method. This is the quickest method to find a better approximation value for the roots of the real-valued function f(x) = 0. The idea behind Newton’s method is that the continuous and the differentiable functions are approximated by using the straight-line tangent to it. Newton’s method formula is given as:

X1 = x0 -(f(x0)/f’(x0))

Here

X0 is the initial value

f(x0) is the function at the initial value x0

f’(x0) is the first derivative of the function at the initial value x0

The process can be continued many times until the better approximation value is obtained.

data.post_title: Wheatstone Bridge Calculator - Free Online Calculator
data.post_description: Learn how to use the Wheatstone bridge calculator with a step-by-step procedure. Get the Wheatstone bridge calculator available online for free only at CoolGyan'S.
data.post_content:
Formula for Bridge Voltage: Vb= Vin*(RxRx+Rc −RbRb+Ra )

Input Voltage (Vin): v

Resistance (Ra): ohms

Resistance (Rb): ohms

Resistance (Rc): ohms

Resistance (Rx): ohms

Bridge Voltage (Vb) = v

 

Wheatstone Bridge Calculator is a free online tool that displays the bridge voltage of the circuit. CoolGyan’S online Wheatstone bridge calculator tool performs the calculation faster, and it displays the bridge voltage in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Wheatstone Bridge Calculator? 

The procedure to use the Wheatstone bridge calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the input voltage, resistance value in the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Calculate Bridge Voltage” to get the result

Step 3: Finally, the bridge voltage will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by the Wheatstone Bridge?

In Physics, the Wheatstone bridge is also known as the resistance bridge. The Wheatstone bridge consists of four arms. The two arms consist of known resistance, and the other two arms consist of variable resistance and unknown resistance. The Wheatstone bridge consists of an electromotive force and a galvanometer. It works on the principle of null deflection. The bridge is considered to be in a balanced condition when no current flows through the galvanometer. Generally, this condition is achieved by adjusting the known and the variable resistance. The formula to calculate the bridge voltage is given as:

\(v_{b}= v_{in}\ast (\frac{R_{x}}{R_{x}+R_{c}}-\frac{R_{b}}{R_{b}+R_{a}})\)

Where

Vin is the input voltage

Vb is the bridge voltage

Ra, Rb, Rc, Rx are the resistance.

What is Gay Lussac’s Law?

Gay Lussac’s law is also called pressure law. This law states the absolute pressure is directly proportional to the temperature. When the gas of constant amount is present in a closed and rigid vessel, then the relationship between pressure and temperature of the gas is measured through Gay Lussac’s law, under the condition that the volume of gas remains constant.  The relationship between pressure and temperature is given by:

Pi/Ti = Pf/Tf

where Pi and Ti are initial pressure and temperature

and Pf and Tf are final values of pressure and temperature.

data.post_content:

Total Work (wT)= j

Total Work Calculator is a free online tool that displays the total work done on the object for the given inputs. CoolGyan’S online Total work calculator tool makes the calculation faster, and it shows the result in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Total Work Calculator?

The procedure to use the total work calculator is as follows:
Step 1: Enter the mass (m), initial and final velocities in the respective input fields
Step 2: Now click the button “Calculate Total Work” to get the output
Step 3: Finally, the value of total work will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by the Total Work Done?

In physics, the principle of work and kinetic energy states that the work done by all forces acting on a particle (the work of the resultant force) equals the change in the kinetic energy of the particle. This is also known as the work–energy principle. That is, the work W done by the resultant force on a particle equals the change in the particle’s kinetic energy Ek. If vi and vf are the initial and final velocities respectively corresponding to the beginning and end of some time interval, then the total work done (WT) on the object is given by the formula:
WT = 1/2mvf2 – 1/2mvi2

What is Arithmetic Mean?

In statistics, one of the most important concepts is an arithmetic mean. The arithmetic mean of the given data can be calculated by adding all the numbers given divided by the total number of values in the set. The arithmetic mean is also called an average. The mean is the commonly used measure of central tendency.

Standard Form

The standard formula to represent the arithmetic mean is as follows:

Arithmetic Mean = (x1 + x2 + x3+….. + xn ) / n

Where x1, x2, x3, …, xn are the data values

“n” is the total number of values given

The other form to represent the arithmetic mean is as follows:

Arithmetic Mean = Σ (xi /n)

Frequently Asked Questions on Arithmetic Mean Calculator

What is the arithmetic mean of 5, 10, 20, 25 and 30?

Given data: 5, 10, 20, 25, and 30

The arithmetic mean = (5+10+20+25+30)/5

= 90/5

Arithmetic mean = 18

Mention the types of mean in Statistics.

The different types of mean in Statistics are:

  • Arithmetic Mean
  • Geometric Mean
  • Harmonic Mean
  • Weighted Mean

What is the formula for the arithmetic mean?

The formula for the arithmetic mean is:

Arithmetic Mean = Σ (xi /n)

Where “xi” is the values in the data set.

“n” is the total number of values in the data set

data.post_content:

Step 3: Finally, the interpolating polynomial and the graph will be displayed in the new window

What is Meant by Lagrange Interpolation?

In Mathematics, interpolation is defined as the estimation of the value within the known sequence values. Lagrange polynomial interpolation is defined as the process of determining the values within the known data points. Lagrange interpolating polynomial is a method of calculating the polynomial equations for the corresponding curves that have coordinates points. This method provides a good approximation of the polynomial functions. Lagrange polynomial is a polynomial with the lowest degree that assumes each value to the corresponding values. When applying Lagrange interpolation for the given set of points with unequal values, the function coincides with each point.

Finding Lagrange Polynomial

To find the Lagrange interpolating polynomial, the following formula is used.

\(P(x) = \sum_{j=0}^{n}y_{j}\left ( \prod_{i=0,i\neq j }^{n}\frac{X – x_{i}}{x_{j}-x_{i}} \right )\)

With the coordinates (x0, y0), …., (xn, yn) and distinct xi.

For example, if we take the known data points such as (2, 3), (4, 5), (5, 7), and (7, 9) be the known data values, then the Lagrange interpolating polynomial is given by:
-(2x3/15) + (9x2/5) – (91x/15) + 9

Area of a Rhombus Calculator is a free online tool that displays the rhombus area when the base and height are given. CoolGyan’S online area of a rhombus calculator tool performs the calculation faster, and it displays the rhombus area in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Area of a Rhombus Calculator? 

The procedure to use the area of a rhombus calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the base value and height of the rhombus in the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Solve” to get the rhombus area

Step 3: Finally, the area of the rhombus will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by the Area of a Rhombus?

In Geometry, a rhombus is a closed two-dimensional figure with four sides. All the four sides of a rhombus are equal in measure. It is a type of parallelogram, in which the opposite sides and angles are equal. The area of rhombus is the space occupied by the shape rhombus. The area of the rhombus can be found using three different methods, and the formulas are given as follows:

Case 1: If the diagonals p and q are given, then the formula to calculate the area is

Area of a rhombus, A = pq/2 square units

Case 2: If the base and altitude (height) are given:

Area of a rhombus, A= b×h square units

Case 3: If the angles are given, then the formula is

Area of a rhombus, A = b2 ×(sin a) square units.

Now, let us see an example to find the area of a rhombus if the base and height are given.

Example: 

Find the area of a rhombus if the base length and height of the rhombus are 7cm and 5 cm respectively.

Solution:

Given:

Base = 7 cm

Height (altitude) = 5 cm

We know that, if the base and height are given, then the formula to calculate the area is:

Area of rhombus = b×h square units

Now, substitute the values in the formula, we get

A = b×h 

A= 7× 5 cm2.

A = 35 cm2.

Therefore, the area of a rhombus is 35cm2.

Sine Cosine Tangent Calculator is a free online tool that displays the solution of the trigonometric functions such as sine, cosine and tangent functions. CoolGyan’S online sine cosine tangent calculator tool performs the calculation faster and it displays the value of the sine, cosine and tangent function in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Sine Cosine Tangent Calculator? 

The procedure to use the sine cosine tangent calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the value of the adjacent side and the opposite side of the right triangle in the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Solve” to get the values of trigonometric functions

Step 3: Finally, the value of sine, cosine, and tangent function along with the side length of the hypotenuse will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by Sine Cosine Tangent?

In trigonometry, the three most important trigonometric functions are sine, cosine and tangent functions. The reciprocal of these three basic functions are cosecant, secant and cotangent functions. The trigonometric functions are defined based on the angles and sides of the right triangle. With the help of these functions, the unknown sides or the angles of the right triangle can be determined easily. We know that three sides of the right triangle are:

  • Opposite side – The side opposite to the angle θ
  • Adjacent Side –  The side which forms the angle of interest, say θ
  • Hypotenuse – The side opposite to the right angle, and it should be the longest side of the triangle

Based on these sides, the trigonometric functions, such as sine, cosine and tangent is given by the formulas,

Sin θ = Opposite Side / Hypotenuse

Cos θ = Adjacent Side / Hypotenuse

Tan θ = Opposite Side / Adjacent Side

Solved Example on Sine Cosine Tangent

Example 1:

Determine the value of sin θ, cos θ and tan θ, whose opposite side, adjacent side, and the hypotenuse of the right triangle are 3 cm, 4 cm and 5 cm respectively.

Solution:

Given that,

Opposite side = 3 cm

Adjacent side = 4 cm

Hypotenuse = 5 cm

We know the formula to calculate the sin θ, cos θ and tan θ.

Now substitute the values in the formula, we get

Sin θ = Opposite Side / Hypotenuse

Sin θ = 3/ 5 = 0.6

Cos θ = Adjacent Side / Hypotenuse

Cos θ = 4/5 = 0.8

Tan θ = Opposite Side / Adjacent Side

Tan θ = 3/4 = 0.75

Multiplying Integers Calculator is a free online tool that displays the product of two integers. Multiplying integers calculator can be used to multiply any two positive or negative integers instantly. The integers are whole numbers including 0, positive number and negative numbers. The fractions, decimals, and percents do not fall under the integers category.

How to Use Integers Multiplication Calculator?

In the integer multiplication calculator tool, there are two input boxes and a multiplication sign in the middle. To multiply any two integers, follow the steps given below.

  • Step 1: Enter any integer in the first input box.
  • Step 2: Enter another integer in the second input box.
  • Step 3: Click on “Solve” to compute the value of the integers.

How to Multiply Integers?

It is known that integers can be positive or negative. To multiply integers, their signs should always be taken into account. The resultant sign for multiplying different polynomials is given in the following table.

Rules to Multiply Integers:

Type of Integer Resultant Sign Example
2 Positive Integers Positive a × b = ab
2 Negative Integers Negative Sign – a × – b = – ab
1 Positive and 1 Negative Integer Negative Sign – a × b = – ab

Or,

a × – b = – ab

Solved Examples

Example 1:

Simplify -4 × 20

Solution:

Given that, -4 × 20

In this case, the first integer has a negative sign and the second integer has a positive sign, hence the result should be negative.

-4 × 20 = -80

Example 2:

Simplify -20 × -50

Solution:

Given:  -20 × -50

Here, two given integers are negative, hence the multiplication of two negative integers will result in a positive integer.

Therefore, -20 × -50 = 1000

Frequently Asked Questions on Multiplying Integers

Do We Get an Integer After Multiplying Two Integers?

Yes, multiplying two integers always result in an integer. The resultant integer can be either a positive integer, a negative integer or 0.

What are the Rules of Multiplying Integers?

There are three basic rules of integer multiplication. The rules are:

  • Multiplying two positive integers always result in a positive integer.
  • Multiplying two negative integers always result in a negative integer.
  • Multiplying a positive or negative integer always result in a negative integer.

What are the Basic Operations That Can be Performed on Integers?

There are four basic operations that can be performed on integers which are the addition of integers, subtraction of integers, division of integers, and multiplication of integers.

Distributive Property in Maths

In Mathematics, the numbers should obey the characteristic property during the arithmetic operations. The different properties are associative property, commutative property, distributive property, inverse property, identity property and so on. The distributive property is the one which allows us to multiply the number by a group of numbers, which are added together. The distributive property is given by: a(b+c) = ab + ac

Example

Question:
Simplify the given expression 4(2 + 8)
Solution:
Given expression: 4(2+ 8)
We know that the distributive property is given by:
a(b+c) = ab+ ac
Hence,
4(2 + 8) = 4(2) + 4(8)
=8+ 32
= 40
Therefore, 4 (2+8) is 40

data.post_content:
Rationalize the denominator calculator is a free online tool that gives the rationalized denominator for the given input. CoolGyan’S online rationalize the denominator calculator tool makes the calculations faster and easier where it displays the result in a fraction of seconds.

What is Rationalization of a Number?

Rationalization is the process of removing the imaginary numbers from the denominator of an algebraic expression. It is the method of moving the radical (i.e., square root or cube root) from the bottom (denominator) of the fraction to the top (numerator). To remove the radicals, multiply both the numerator and denominator by the conjugate of the denominator.

Standard Form

The standard form to represent the rationalization of a denominator is given as follows:

Consider a fractional number, 1/(a-√b)

The rationalized form of the number is written as

[1/(a-√b)] × [(a+√b) / (a+√b)]

Rationalized Form= [(a+√b) / (a2 -b)]

Frequently Asked Questions on Rationalize The Denominator

What is meant by rationalization?

Rationalization in Maths is the process of removing the radical or imaginary number from the denominator of a fraction. This method is also known as rationalizing the denominator.

What is meant by surds?

A fraction contains two parts. One is the numerator, and the other is a denominator. The number i.e., square root or cube root that cannot be simplified further is called surd. The surd may be either numerator or denominator.

How to rationalize the denominator?

The denominator of a fraction can be rationalised by taking the conjugate of a denominator and multiplying it by both the numerator and denominator.

data.post_description: Cramer's Rule Calculator is available online for free, here at CoolGyan'S. Find the solution of linear equations in two variables with the help of a calculator and save your time.
data.post_content:
Enter System of Equations

x + y =
x + y =

Δ =

Δ y =

x =

The solution is (x, y) = (, )

The Cramer’s Rule Calculator (2 x 2) is an online tool that finds the solution of linear equations in two variables, by finding the determinant of the coefficient matrix. We need to enter the real coefficients of the equations, in the input field to get the output. CoolGyan’S free online Calculator makes it easy to find the solutions of equations, simply and easily.

Cramer’s Rule Formula: If we are given with two linear equations,
a1x + b1y = c1
a2x + b2y = c2

Then the main determinant of the 2×2 matrix formed by the coefficients of linear equations is given by:
\(∆ =\left|\begin{array}{ll}
a_{1} & b_{1} \\
a_{2} & b_{2}
\end{array}\right|\)

The other two determinants are:
\(∆x=\left|\begin{array}{ll}
c_{1} & b_{1} \\
c_{2} & b_{2}
\end{array}\right| \quad \text { and } \quad ∆y=\left|\begin{array}{ll}
a_{1} & c_{1} \\
a_{2} & c_{2}
\end{array}\right|\)

Therefore, the solution of the two given equations are:

X = ∆x/∆ and Y = ∆y/∆

If all the determinants are zero, then the equations are dependent and the system is consistent and have infinitely many solutions. If ∆=0 and ∆x & ∆y are not equal to zero, then the system is inconsistent and the equations do not have any solution.

How to Solve Linear Equations Using Determinants?

To find the solution of linear equations using the determinant of coefficients, with the help of calculators, follow the below steps.

Step 1: Write all the coefficients of linear equations in the respective input fields.

Step 2: Click on “Solve these equations” button

Step 3: The value of the main determinant and x & y determinants will appear in the respective fields. Also, the solution of equations, i.e. value of x and y will appear in the respective output field.

Solved Example

Find the solution of the given equations, using Cramer’s rule:
2x+3y = 4
x+2y = 3

Solution: a1 = 2, b1 = 3 and c1 = 4
a2 = 1, b2 = 2 and c2 = 3

Determinant,
∆ = 1

The other two determinants are:
∆x=-1
∆y=2
Therefore, the solution of the two given equations are:
x = ∆x/∆ = -1/1 = -1
and y = ∆y/∆ = 2/1 = 1

data.post_content:
Inverse function calculator helps in computing the inverse value of any function that is given as input. To recall, an inverse function is a function which can reverse another function. It is also called an anti function. It is denoted as:

f(x) = y ⇔ f− 1(y) = x

How to Use the Inverse Function Calculator?

This calculator to find inverse function is an extremely easy online tool to use. Follow the below steps to find the inverse of any function.

  • Step 1: Enter any function in the input box i.e. across “The inverse function of” text.
  • Step 2: Click on “Submit” button at the bottom of the calculator.
  • Step 3: A separate window will open where the inverse of the given function will be computed.

How to Find the Inverse of a Function?

To find the inverse of any function, first, replace the function variable with the other variable and then solve for the other variable by replacing each other. An example is provided below for better understanding.

Example: Find the inverse of f(x) = y = 3x − 2

Solution:

First, replace f(x) with f(y).

Now, the equation y = 3x − 2 will become,

x = 3y − 2

Solve for y,

y = (x + 2)/3

Thus, the inverse of y = 3x − 2 is y = (x + 2)/3/

Frequently Asked Questions on Inverse Function

How do you find the inverse of a function?

To find the inverse of a function, write the function y as a function of x i.e. y = f(x) and then solve for x as a function of y.

What is the inverse of 6?

The inverse of 6 is ⅙. For any function “x”, the inverse will be “1/x”.

What is Meant by the Greater Than Less Than Fraction?

In maths, a fraction is a number that represents a part of a single whole object or a group of objects. It is defined by two numbers, one on the top and the other at the bottom of a fraction bar, known as numerator and denominator respectively. While comparing fractions, we represent the inequality if two or more given fractions using greater than and less than symbols. Suppose 3/4 and 1/2 are two fractions such that 3/4 is greater than 1/2, i.e. 3/4 > 1/2 or 1/2 is less than 3/4, i.e. 1/2 < 3/4. However, to compare the fractions, it is necessary to make the denominators equal (that means like fractions) as given below:

3/4 = 3/4

1/2 = (1/2)×(2/2) = 2/4

Now, the denominators are equal and 3 > 2.
Therefore, 3/4 > 1/2 .

The Perimeter of Regular N-polygon Calculator is an online tool that calculates the perimeter of any regular polygon, provided the side-length is given. CoolGyan’S free calculator helps in solving mathematical problems in a simple and quick way.

Perimeter of Polygon

A polygon is a closed two dimensional shape, made up of straight lines connected end to end. The straight lines connected to each other through nodes are called sides of polygon and the point where the two sides joins, is called vertex of polygon. A regular polygon has all its sides equal in length and all its angles equal in measure.

The perimeter of an n-sides polygon is equal to the sum of all its sides.

Perimeter of N-sided Polygon = Sum of all the sides

If a regular polygon has 5 sides then the perimeter is given by:

Perimeter of 5-sided polygon = 5 (side-length)

Hence, we can calculate the perimeter of any regular polygon, by knowing its side-length.

How to find Perimeter of Regular N-polygon using Calculator?

To find the perimeter of n-sided regular polygon, using calculator, follow the steps given here.

Step 1: Enter the value of number of sides and length of sides of polygon, in the respective input fields

Step 2: Click the “Solve” button to get result

Step 3: The perimeter of the polygon will appear in the output field

Solved Examples

Q.1: Find the perimeter of equilateral triangle whose side length is 5cm.

Solution: Since equilateral triangle is also a regular 3-sided polygon, therefore,

Perimeter = 3 x (side-length)

P = 3 x 5 = 15cm

Q.2: Find the perimeter of a square whose side-length is 4cm.

Solution: Since, a square is also a regular polygon having four equal sides, therefore,

Perimeter = 4 x (side-length)

P = 4 x 4 = 16 cm

Practice Problems

  1. Find the perimeter of a regular hexagon with side-length equal to 3 cm.
  2. If side-length of a pentagon is 4.5 cm, then find its perimeter.

What is summation?

In Mathematics, the summation is the process of addition of any numbers called the addends or summands, which result in the sum or total. Apart from numbers, any values can be summed, such as functions, polynomials, matrices, functions, and so on. In other words, the summation of a sequence is called a series in which the mathematical operation “+” is defined. The notation used to denote summation is “Σ”.

Standard Form

The standard form used to represent the summation is given below:

Frequently Asked Questions on Summation Calculator

What is the difference between the sequence and series?

The numbers which are written in a definite order is called a sequence whereas the sum of the terms of a sequence is called a series.

Why do we use summation?

Usually, Mathematical formulas require the addition of many variables, the summation method is convenient, and it gives a concise expression for the sum of the values of the variables.

How to represent the summation?

The symbol used to represent the summation is “Σ”. This sigma symbol is generally used to denote the sum of multiple terms.

While multiplying two binomials, the first term of the first binomial expression should be multiplied with the first and second terms of the second binomial, and similarly, the second term of the first binomial should be multiplied with the first and second term of the second binomial. Thus, four times a multiplication process can be performed when multiplying two binomials. The multiplication of two binomials can be performed using different methods, such as horizontal method, vertical method, FOIL method etc. While multiplying two binomials, the “FOIL” method is used. It means F- First, O-Outer, I-Inner, L-Last.

Dividing Mixed Fractions Calculator is a free online tool that displays the division of two mixed fractions. CoolGyan’S online dividing mixed fractions calculator tool performs the calculation faster and it displays the result of the division process in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Dividing Mixed Fractions Calculator? 

The procedure to use the dividing mixed fractions calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the whole number and the fractional part value in the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Solve”  to get the division of two numbers

Step 3: Finally, the division of two mixed fractions will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by the Dividing Mixed Fractions?

We know that the fraction represents the part of the whole. It is of the form a/b. The value mentioned in the top is called the numerator, and the value mentioned in the bottom is called the denominator. There are three different types of fractions. They are proper fraction, improper fraction, and mixed fraction.

  • In a proper fraction, the numerator value is lesser than the denominator value. Example: 5/7
  • In an improper fraction, the numerator value is greater than the denominator value. Example:9/8
  • A mixed fraction is a combination of a whole number and a proper fraction. Example: 2 ½.

 

Like integers, the fractions can also be added, subtracted, multiplied and divided. While dividing two mixed fractions, follow the below steps.

  1. Convert the mixed fraction into the improper fraction
  2. Now, take the reciprocal of the second fraction (i.e., divisor)
  3. Now, multiply the first fraction and the second fraction
  4. Simplify the fractions, if required

Solved Example on Dividing Mixed Fractions

Example:

Divide 3 ½  by 2 ½ 

Solution:

Given that, (3 ½) / (2 ½)

Now, convert the given mixed fraction into the improper fraction

(3 ½) / (2 ½) = (7/2) /(5/2)

Now, take the reciprocal of the divisor and multiply it by the first fraction

(3 ½) / (2 ½) = (7/2).(2/5)

Simplify the above expression, we get

(3 ½) / (2 ½) = 7/5

Hence, the division of 3 ½ by 2 ½ is 7/5.

Multiplying 3 fractions calculator is a simple and free online tool which can compute the product of three fractions easily. In maths, a fraction represents a part of a whole i.e. how many parts of a whole are there. A fraction is represented as “a/b” where “a” is the numerator and “b” is the denominator.

Steps to Use Multiplying Three Fractions Calculator

This 3 fractions multiplying tool is extremely easy to use. The steps to use this calculator are:

  • Step 1: Enter the first fraction in a/b format.
  • Step 2: Enter the second fraction
  • Step 3: Enter the third fraction.
  • Step 4: Click on the “Multiply” button.

After clicking on the “Multiply” button, the tool will give the product of the three fractions in fraction form and in decimal form.

How to Multiply 3 Fractions?

For multiplying fractions, multiply the numerators and denominators of the given fraction. To multiply any 3 fractions, multiply the three numerators and then multiply the three denominators. After multiplying the numerators and denominators, write them as fractions. This will give the product of 3 fractions in fractional form. To get in decimal form, divide the numerator of the fractional product with its denominator.

For example, consider the fractions ¼ × ⅖ × ⅛.

In this, first multiply all the numerators: 1×2×1 = 2

Similarly, multiply all the denominators: 4×5×8 = 160

Now, the product of the three fractions will be 2/160.

Frequently Asked Questions on Multiplying 3 Fractions

What are the types of a fraction?

There are three main types of fractions which are:

  • Proper fractions
  • Improper fractions
  • Mixed fractions

Apart from these three, there are other categories like equivalent fractions, like fractions, unlike fractions, etc.

Is ⅗ a proper fraction?

Yes, ⅗ is a proper fraction. For a fraction to be proper, the numerator should be smaller than the denominator. For ⅗, 3<5 and so, it is a proper fraction.

Multiply ⅔ x ½

Multiply the numerators first and then the denominators.

So, ⅔ × ½ = (2×1)/(3×2) = 2/6.

data.post_content:

Parallel Plate Capacitor Calculator is a free online tool that displays the capacitance value of the parallel plate capacitor. CoolGyan’S online parallel plate capacitor calculator tool performs the calculation faster and it displays the capacitance value in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Parallel Plate Capacitor Calculator? 

The procedure to use the parallel plate capacitor calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the area, separation distance, and x for the unknown value in the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Calculate x” to get the capacitance value

Step 3: Finally, the capacitance of the parallel plate capacitor will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by Parallel Plate Capacitors?

In Physics, the arrangement of electrodes and dielectric material forms a parallel plate capacitor. If the two parallel plates are connected across the battery, the plates are charged and the eclectic field is formed between the two plates. This kind of arrangement is called the parallel plate capacitor. But, it can be capable of storing only a finite amount of energy before the breakdown of the dielectric field occurs. The parallel plate capacitor consists of two plates with area “A”, which are separated by the distance “d”, then the capacitance of the parallel plate capacitors is given by the formula,

Parallel Plate Capacitor Formula, C = kε0 (A/d)

Where,

“A” = Area 

“d” = Separation distance between two plates

“k” = Relative permittivity of the dielectric material

“ε0” = Permittivity of the space which is equal to 8.854 × 10−12 F/m

 Solved Example on Parallel Plate Capacitor

Example:

Determine the capacitance of the parallel plate capacitor in air, whose area is 4.2 m2, and the separation distance between two plates is 0.5m.

Solution:

Given that, the area, A is 4.2 m2

The separation distance between two plates “d” is 0.5 m.

We know that the relative permittivity “k” of dielectric material in the air is 1.

ε0 =  8.854 × 10−12 F/m

We know that the formula to calculate the capacitance of the parallel plate capacitor is 

C=kε0 (A/d)

Now, substitute the values in the formula, we get

C =(1)(8.854 × 10−12) (4.2/0.5)

C = (1)(8.854 × 10−12 ) (8.4)

C = (8.4)(8.854 × 10−12 )

C = 74.373× 10−12

C = 7.437× 10−11 F

Hence, the capacitance of the parallel plate capacitor is 7.437× 10−11 F.

What is Meant by Sound Wavelength?

In Physics, the sound waves are defined as the pattern of disturbances which is caused by the movement of energy travelling through the mediums, such as air, liquid or solid. In other words, the sound is defined as a vibration which propagates through the medium in the form of mechanical waves. The sound can be travelled fast in solid, slower in liquid, and relatively slowest in the gaseous mediums. The three most important characteristics of the sound waves are:

  • Wavelength – It is defined as the distance in which the shape of the wave repeats. It is measured in terms of meters
  • Wave frequency – It is defined as the number of refractions and compression which occur per unit time. The frequency is measured in terms of Hertz
  • Wave velocity – It is the measure, which is used to calculate how fast does the sound wave propagate in the given medium. The unit of wave velocity is meter per second.

The formula to calculate sound wavelength is given by

Sound Wavelength (λ)= Sound Velocity (V) /Sound Frequency (F) .

In statistics and probability theory, hypergeometric distribution is defined as the discrete probability distribution, which describes the probability of success in various draws without replacement. Some of the statistical properties of the hypergeometric distribution are mean, variance, standard deviation, skewness, kurtosis. This distribution is applicable for the finite population without replacement, and the trials are dependent.

data.post_description: Learn how to use the area of regular polygon calculator with a step-by-step procedure. Get the area of regular polygon calculator available online for free only at CoolGyan'S.
data.post_content:
Enter the number of sides(n)=
Enter the side length(S)=
Area of the Polygon= square units

Area of Regular Polygon Calculator is a free online tool that displays the area occupied by the regular polygons in the two-dimensional plane. CoolGyan’S online area of regular polygon calculator tool performs the calculation faster and it displays the area of a regular polygon in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Area of Regular Polygon Calculator? 

The procedure to use the area of regular polygon calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the number of sides and side length in the input field (Example: n=5, S= 3)

Step 2: Now click the button “Solve” to get the regular polygon area

Step 3: Finally, the area of the regular polygon will be displayed in the output field (I.e., Area of Regular Polygon, A= 15.485 square units)

What is Meant by the Area of Regular Polygon?

In Geometry, a polygon is a plane figure with the straight sides, A polygon should have at least three sides. There are different types of polygon, namely regular polygon, irregular polygon, convex polygon, concave polygon, and so on. A regular polygon should have equal side lengths and equal angle. It means that a polygon should be equiangular and equilateral. Whereas the irregular polygon has unequal side lengths and angles. The area of the regular polygon is the region occupied by the regular polygon. Based on the number of sides of a polygon, it is classified as a triangle, quadrilateral, pentagon, etc. The area of the regular polygon is given by

If “n” is the number of sides of a polygon, and “s” is the side length of the polygon, then

The Area of a regular polygon, A = [S2n]/[4tan(180/n)] Square units

If the circum-radius “r” of the regular polygon is given, then

A = [r2n sin(360/n)]/2 Square units

Area of Regular Polygon Example

Example 1: 

Calculate the area of the regular polygon given that the number of sides is 5 and the side length is 3cm 

Solution:

Given that, number of sides, n = 5

Side length, S = 3cm

We know that the area of the regular polygon = [S2n]/[4tan(180/n)] 

By substituting the values, we get

A = [32 (5)]/[4tan(180/5)] 

A = (45)/(4 tan 36)

A = 45/ 4(0.7265)

A = 45/2.906

A = 15.485

Therefore, the area of a regular pentagon = 15.485 cm2

Also, check: Area of Regular Polygon Formula

Example 2:

Evaluate the area of the regular pentagon whose circum-radius is 2cm.

Solution:

Given that, circumradius  = 2 cm

Number of sides = 5

If the circumradius is given, the area of the regular pentagon is given as:

Area = [r2n sin(360/n)]/2 Square units

A =[22(5) sin(360/5)]/2

A =[20 sin(360/5)]/2

A =[20 sin 72]/2

A = 20(0.951)/2

A = 19.02/2

A = 9.51

Therefore, the area of the regular pentagon with radius 2 cm is 9.51cm2.

Step 3: The value of the variable “x” will be displayed in the output “x” field

What is Pythagorean Theorem?

The Pythagorean Theorem states that “In a right-angled triangle, the square of the hypotenuse side is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides”. It defines the three sides of the right triangle, such as the perpendicular side, adjacent side (base), and the hypotenuse side. This theorem is mainly used to determine the length of the legs and the hypotenuse side.

Read more on Pythagoras Theorem

Standard Formula

The standard formula to represent the Pythagorean Theorem is:

Perpendicular2 + Base2 = Hypotenuse2

(or)

a2 + b2 = c2

Frequently Asked Questions on Pythagorean Theorem Calculator

Define Pythagorean theorem.

The Pythagoras (or Pythagorean) theorem states that the square of the hypotenuse side of a right triangle is equal the sum of the squares of the other two sides of a right triangle

What are the applications of the Pythagorean theorem?

Pythagoras (or Pythagorean) Theorem is used for

  • Finding the diagonal of a square
  • Checking whether a triangle is a right-angled triangle or not
  • Determining the unknown side of the right-angle triangle if the other two sides are given

What is Pythagorean Triple?

Pythagorean triples is a set of positive integers, such as a, b and c, that fits the rule:

a^2 + b^2 = c^2 …..(1)

For example, if a, b, and c are 3, 4, and 5 respectively, then by substituting these values in (1), we get:

3^2 + 4^2 = 5^2

9 + 16 = 25

25 = 25

Then, the given set of positive integers are called a Pythagorean Triple.

Convert 56 square foot into acre

We know that to convert square feet into acres, we have to divide the given number by 43560.

Thus, 56 square foot into acre is

Acre = 56/43560

Acre = 0.001285

Hence, 56 square foot is equal to 0.001285 acres.

Example 2: 

Convert 1246 square foot into acres

Solution:

We know that 43560 square feet are equal to 1 acre

Hence, the conversion of 1246 square foot into acres is

Acre = 1246/43560

Acre = 0.0286

Therefore 1246 square feet is equal to 0.029 acres

data.post_content:
Laplace Transform Calculator is a free online tool that displays the transformation of the real variable function to the complex variable. CoolGyan’S online Laplace transform calculator tool makes the calculations faster and the integral change is displayed in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Laplace Transform Calculator?

Step 3: The result will be displayed in the new window

What is the Laplace Transform?

In Mathematics, the Laplace transform is an integral transformation, which transforms the real variable function “t” to the complex variable function. The main purpose of this transformation is to convert the ordinary differential equations into an algebraic equation that helps to solve the ordinary differential equations easily. Laplace transform has many applications in the field of Science and Engineering.

Standard Form

The standard form to represent the Laplace transform is as follows:

\(F(s)=L(f(t))= \int_{0}^{\infty }e^{-st}f(t)dt\)

Where

f(t) is defined for all real numbers t ≥ 0

“s” is the complex number frequency parameter

Frequently Asked Questions on Laplace Transform Calculator

What is the main purpose of the Laplace Transform?

The main purpose of the Laplace transform is to transform the Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) into algebraic equations. This conversion helps to solve the ODEs easily.

Mention the significance of the Laplace Transform

The Laplace transform gives useful techniques for determining certain types of differential equations when initial conditions are given, especially when the primary values are zero.

Write down the applications of the Laplace transform.

The applications of the Laplace transform are:

  • Circuit Analysis
  • Signal processing
  • Communication Systems

In maths, a fraction is a number that represents a part of a single whole object or a group of objects. It is defined by two numbers, one on the top and the other at the bottom of a fraction bar, known as numerator and denominator respectively. Depending upon the similarity of the denominator, two or more fractions can be categorized into like fractions and unlike fractions. They are also termed sometimes as similar fractions and dissimilar fractions. These terms are often used while comparing fractions. Like fractions are those fractions which have the same denominators. Some examples of like fractional pairs are (25/17, 8/17), (5/2, 1/2), (6/34, 12/34) and so on.

Here, the top number 5 is called the numerator, and the bottom number 8 is called the denominator. The fractions can be classified into different types, namely proper fraction, improper fraction, mixed fraction, like fraction, unlike fractions, equivalent fractions. Let us consider two fractions, 15/20 and 9/12. These fractions are said to be an equivalent fraction because when the fractions are simplified, the resultant fraction will be the same. What is Meant by Event in Probability?

In probability, an event can be defined as the set of outcomes of an experiment. Event is the subset of sample space of the random experiment. Probability of an event is the ratio of the number of outcomes favorable to the event to the total number of possible outcomes of the experiment. P(E) = n(E)/ n(S)

Here,

n(E) = Number outcomes favorable to event E

n(S) = Total number of outcomes (i.e. total number of elements in the sample space)

data.post_description: Feet to centimeter calculator is available online here at CoolGyan'S for free. 1 ft is equal to 30.48 cm. Check the heights in foot + inches and convert them into centimeters easily.
data.post_content:

feet

Feet to Centimeter Calculator is a free online tool that displays the conversion of the feet to a centimeter value. CoolGyan’S online feet to centimeter calculator tool performs the calculation faster, and it displays the conversion value in a fraction of seconds.

Feet: This unit is usually used to measure the height. For example, height of a person, a tree, a building, etc.

One Foot is equal to 30.48 centimeters.

1 foot = 30.48 cm

And

10 feet = 304.8 cm

Therefore, foot is the singular form of feet.

Also, one foot is equal to 12 inches

1 ft = 12 in

How to Convert Feet to Centimeters?

The procedure to use the feet to centimeter calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the feet value the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Convert” to get the conversion value

Step 3: Finally, the conversion from feet to centimeter value will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by Feet to Centimeter Conversion?

The feet to centimeter calculator gives the conversion of measurement from the unit feet to centimeter. The unit feet is represented by “ft” and the centimeter is represented by “cm”. Centimeter is considered as a part of the metric system and is used in the International System of units. The unit feet is used in the US customary measurement system. One foot is approximately equal to 30.48 centimeters.

1 ft = 30.48 cm

For example, the conversion of 5 ft to cm is given as follows:

We know that 1 ft = 30.48 cm

So 5 ft = 5 x 30.48 cm

5 ft = 152.4 cm.

Therefore, the conversion of 5 feet to the centimeter is 152.4 cm.

Feet + Inches into Centimeter

We would also come across the value of the length in feet and inches. Therefore, to convert feet and inches into centimeters, we have to convert the value completely into inches and then convert into cm.

As we know, 1 foot = 12 inches. Now if we multiply 12 inches by 2.54, we will get the value of length in centimeters. See some examples of human heights converted into centimeters:

  • 5 feet 1 inches in cm = [(5×12)+1] x 2.54 = 61 x 2.54 = 154.94 cm
  • 5 feet 2 inches in cm = [(5×12)+2] x 2.54 = 62 x 2.54 = 157.48 cm
  • 5 feet 3 inches in cm = [(5×12)+3] x 2.54 = 63 x 2.54 = 160.02 cm
  • 5 feet 4 inches in cm = [(5×12)+4] x 2.54 = 64 x 2.54 = 162.56 cm
  • 5 feet 5 inches in cm = [(5×12)+5] x 2.54 = 65 x 2.54 = 165.1 cm
  • 5 feet 6 inches in cm = [(5×12)+6] x 2.54 = 66 x 2.54 = 167.64 cm
  • 5 feet 7 inches in cm = [(5×12)+7] x 2.54 = 67 x 2.54 = 170.18 cm
  • 5 feet 8 inches in cm = [(5×12)+8] x 2.54 = 68 x 2.54 = 172.72 cm
  • 5 feet 9 inches in cm = [(5×12)+9] x 2.54 = 69 x 2.54 = 175.26 cm
  • 5 feet 10 inches in cm = [(5×12)+10] x 2.54 = 70 x 2.54 = 177.8 cm

Conversion Table For Feet to Centimeter

The following is the conversion table for the feet to centimeter:

Feet (ft) Centimeter (cm)
1 ft 30.48 cm
2 ft 60.96 cm
3 ft 91.44 cm
4 ft 121.92 cm
5 ft 152.4 cm
6 ft 182.88 cm
7 ft 213.36 cm
8 ft 243.84 cm
9 ft 274.32 cm
10 ft 304.8 cm

Frequently Asked Questions on Feet to Centimeter Calculator

How to convert feet to cm value?

To convert feet to cm, multiply the given feet value by 30.48 cm. For example 3 ft = 3 x 30.48, we get 91.44 cm.

How many cms is equal to 1 ft?

1 ft is approximately equal to 30.48 cm.

What is the centimeter value of 10 ft?

The centimeter value of 10 ft is 304.8 cm. (i.e.,) 10 x 30.48 = 304.8 cm.

What is Meant by the Chord of a Circle?

data.post_content:
Permutation and Combination Calculator is a free online tool that displays the permutation and combination for the given number of the number of trials. CoolGyan’S online permutation and combination calculator tool performs the calculation faster and it displays the possible number of combinations in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Permutation and Combination Calculator? 

The procedure to use the permutation and combination calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the total items and items at a time in the input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Submit” to get the result

Step 3: Finally, the permutation and combination for the given number of trials will be displayed in the new window

What is Meant by Permutation and Combination?

In mathematics, the permutation is a process of arranging ‘n’ objects taken ‘r’ at a time. The combination is a process of selecting ‘n’ objects taken ‘r’ at a time. To find the possibilities of the given event, the following permutation and combination formulas are used.

Permutation Formula: P(n, r) = (n!)/((n-r)!)

Combination Formula: C(n, r) = (n!)/(r! (n-r)!)

Substitute the value of n and r to the permutations and combinations. 

To recall, the permutation is the process of selecting the elements or the objects in a collection of elements, where the ordering of elements plays an important role. Whereas, the combination is the process of selecting elements from the elements, where the order of elements does not matter. Thus, the permutation and combination is a process, which focuses on the number of ways to select the elements from a set.

What is Meant by Error Function?

In Maths, error function is denoted by erf, which is also known as Gauss error function, is defined as the complex function of the complex variable. It is defined by

\(erf z = \frac{2}{\sqrt{\pi}}\int_{0}^{z}e^{-t^{2}} dt\)

This integral is a sigmoid function that occurs in Statistics, probability, and partial differential equations. The two closely related functions are the complementary error function denoted by “erfc” and the imaginary error function “erfi”.

The complementary error function is defined as:

erfc z = 1- erf z.

The imaginary error function is defined as:

erfi z = -i erf(iz)

For example, assume two monomials, 50 xy and 5y. Now the monomial 50xy is divided by 5y, we will get

= 50xy/5y

= 10x

Thus, the quotient value obtained is 10x, which is the result of the division process.

data.post_content:

Answer =

The Power with Displacement Calculator is an online tool that calculates the value of power with respect to force, displacement and time. CoolGyan’S Power Calculator with displacement makes it easy to solve problems in a simple and quick manner. This calculator not only helps to find the value of power but also we can compute the value of force or displacement or time, provided the other quantities are known.

What is Power with Displacement?

Power with respect to displacement states the amount of work done with a force to cause the displacement of the object in a particular time. Power is defined as the rate of the work done. It is denoted by symbol ‘P’. The unit of power is Watt (W).

Power Formula

If F is the force applied, T is the time taken and D is the displacement of the object, then power required to displace the object is given by:

Power = (Force x Displacement)/Time

P = (F x D)/T

Also, if we have to find the other quantities, then we can use the below given formulas.

Force, F = P x T/D

Displacement, D = P x T/F

Time, T = F x D/P

How to find Power with Displacement Calculator?

To find the power with respect to displacement using the calculator, follow the below steps:

Step 1: Enter the value of force, displacement and time in the respective input fields

Step 2: Mention x in the input field for Power

Step 3: Click the “Calculate the unknown” button to get the required result

Step 4: The value of power will appear in the output field

Example

Find the value of Power if:

Force = 7N

Displacement = 10 meter

Time = 30 s

Solution:

Given, F = 7N, D = 10m, T = 30 s

Therefore, power P = (F x D)/T

P = (7 x 10)/30 = 70/30 = 7/3

P = 2.33 W

What is Meant by Meter to Millimeter Conversion?

The meter to millimeter (m to mm) conversion is the conversion of the measurement unit from meter to millimeter. Both the units are used to calculate the length and distance of the object. The meter and millimeter are used in the International System of Units, called the SI units. The notations to represent the meter and millimeter are “m” and “mm”, respectively. The relation between meter and millimeter is a constant value and it is defined as “One meter is equal to 1000 millimeters”.

1 m = 1000 mm

How to Convert Meter to Millimeter?

To convert meters to millimeters (meter to mm), multiply the given meter value by 1000.

For example, the conversion of 5 m to mm is given as follows:

We know that 1 m = 1000 mm

So 5 m = 5 x 1000 mm

5 m = 5000 mm.

Therefore, the conversion of 5 meters to millimeter is 5000 mm.

Also, read: Metric System

Conversion Table For Meter to Millimeter

The following is the conversion table for meter to millimeter:

Meter (m) Millimeter (mm)
1 m 1000 mm
2 m 2000 mm
3 m 3000 mm
4 m 4000 mm
5 m 5000 mm
6 m 6000 mm
7 m 7000 mm
8 m 8000 mm
9 m 9000 mm
10 m 10000 mm

Meter to mm Examples

Example 1:

Convert 125 meters to mm.

Solution:

We know that one meter is approximately equal to 1000 millimeters.

Therefore,

125 m = 125 x 1000 mm

125 m = 125000 mm.

Therefore, 125 m is equivalent to 125000 mm.

Example 2:

How many millimeters are in 0.05 meters?

Solution:

We know that 1 m = 1000 mm.

Therefore, 

0.05 m = 0.05 x 1000

0.05 m = 50 mm.

Hence, 0.05 meters is equal to 50 mm.

Example 3:

Convert 78 meters to mm.

Solution:

To convert 78 meters to mm.

As 1 m is equivalent to 1000 mm

78 m = 78 x 1000

78 m = 78000 mm

Therefore, 78 meters is equivalent to 78000 millimeters.

Frequently Asked Questions on Meter to Millimeter Calculator

How to convert a meter to millimeter value?

To convert meter to millimeter, multiply the given meter value by 1000 mm. For example 3 m= 3 x 1000, we get 3000 mm.

How many mm is equal to 1 m?

1 m is approximately equal to 1000 mm.

What is the millimeter value of 9 m?

The millimeter value of 9 m is 9000 mm. (i.e.,) 9 x 1000 = 9000 mm.

What is Meant by Half-Life?

The word “half-life” is most generally used with atoms encountering the radioactive decay. It can be used to interpret different kinds of decay, whether exponential or not. Half-life defines the time taken for the substance that undergoes the decaying process to reduce by half. It describes the quantities encountering exponential decay wherever the half-life is consistent over the complete period of the decay. A half-life can also be determined for non-exponential decay processes, though the half-life differs completely in the decay process. One of the most recognized uses of half-life is carbon-14 dating. The half-life of carbon-14 is about 5,730 years, and it can be surely used to estimate dates up to approximately 50,000 years ago. The following formula can calculate the exponential decay process:

N(t) = N0 (1/2)t/t1/2

Where

N(t) = the quantity still remains and has not decayed yet after time “t.”

N0 = the initial quantity of the substance.

t1/2 = the half-life of the decaying quantity.

Standard Deviation Calculator is a free online tool that displays mean, variance, and standard deviation for the given set of data. CoolGyan’S online standard deviation calculator tool makes the calculation faster, and it displays the standard deviation in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Standard Deviation Calculator?

The procedure to use the standard deviation calculator is as follows:

Step 1: Enter the numbers separated by a comma in the respective input field

Step 2: Now click the button “Solve” to get the SD

Step 3: Finally, the mean, variance, and standard deviation for the given set of data will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by Standard Deviation?

Standard Deviation is the measure of dispersion that can be found by how much the values in the given set of data are likely to differ from the mean. The symbol used to denote the standard deviation is σ. Variance and standard deviation both depend on the mean of a given set of numbers. Calculating these set of parameters depends on whether the given set is a sample or the population.

Variance and Standard Deviation of a Population Formula:

The population standard deviation is used to measure the variability of data in the population. The Variance is denoted as σ2 and Standard Deviation as σ and the formula of the population are given by:

\(\large \sigma = \sqrt{\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\left ( x_{i}-\mu \right )^{2}}\\ \large \sigma^{2} = \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\left ( x_{i}-\mu \right )^{2}\)

Where:
σ = population standard deviation
σ2 = population variance
x1, …, xN = the population data set
μ = mean of the population data set
N = size of the population data set

Variance and Standard Deviation of a Sample:
The sample standard deviation is an estimate of a population standard deviation which is based on a given sample. The variance is denoted as s2 and standard deviation as s and the formula for sample standard deviation are given by:

\(\large s=\sqrt{\frac{1}{n-1}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left ( x_{i}-\overline{x} \right )^{2}}\\ \large s^{2}=\frac{1}{n-1}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left ( x_{i}-\overline{x} \right )^{2}\)

Where:
s = sample standard deviation
s2 = sample variance
x1, …, xn = the sample data set
x̄ = mean value of the sample data set
n = size of the sample data set

Therefore, 42 = 16.

The most important rule in multiplying exponents is that, if two base numbers are the same, the exponent value can be added.

What is Multiplication?

Multiplication is a Mathematical operation that is performed between two numbers to get the third number called product. The multiplication is a repeated addition process. The symbol used for the multiplication process is “×” The important terms included in the multiplication process are:

Multiplicand: The number to be multiplied

Multiplier: The number which we multiply

Product: The result obtained from the multiplication of multiplicand and multiplier.

Standard Form

The standard form of a multiplication operation is

Multiplier × Multiplicand = Product

Example: 5 × 2 = 10

Frequently Asked Questions on Multiplying Fractions With Whole Numbers Calculator

Can we multiply fractions with whole numbers?

Yes, we can multiply fractions with whole numbers.

Example: (2/4) × 2 = 1/1 = 1

What is meant by the product?

The product is the resulting value obtained from the multiplication of two numbers.

Example: 10 × 11 = 110

The resulting number 110 is called the product.

Is multiplication a repeated addition process?

Yes, multiplication is a repeated addition process. For example, 2 × 3 = 6. To prove that multiplication is a repeated addition process, add the number thrice. i.e., 2 + 2 + 3 = 6. Hence, it is proved.

data.post_description: Billion to rupees converter tool helps in converting the amount from billions to rupees easily. Visit free online conversion calculator only at CoolGyan’S.
data.post_content:
Billion into Rupees
Billion

Rupees

Billion To Rupees Converter Calculator is a free online tool that displays the conversion from billion to rupees. CoolGyan’S online Billion to Rupees Converter calculator tool makes the calculation faster and it displays the conversion in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Billion To Rupees Converter Calculator?

The procedure to use the billion to rupees conversion calculator is as follows:

Step 2: Now click the button “Convert” to get the conversion value

Step 3: Finally, the conversion value from billions to rupees will be displayed in the output field

Also, read:

Place value

What is Meant by Billion To Rupees Conversion?

In the numeral system, the place value of digits referred in different ways in Indian and International (more specifically the US) numeral system. That means, in the Indian system, place values of digits go in the sequence of Ones, Tens, Hundreds, Thousands, Ten Thousand, Lakhs, Ten Lakhs, Crores and so on. In the International system, place values of digits go in the sequence of Ones, Tens, Hundreds, Thousands, Ten Thousand, Hundred Thousands, Millions, Billions and so on. Therefore, in the conversion of the amount from billions to rupees, 1 billion is taken as 100 crores.

i.e. 1 Billion = 1,000,000,000 rupees

1 Billion = 10,000 lakhs (since 1 lakh = Rs. 100000)

1 Billion = 100 Crores

Frequently Asked Questions on Billion into Rupees Converter

What is the value of 1 billion?

One billion can be written as b or bn. The value of 1 billion is ten thousand lakhs in the Indian numeral system. In terms of crores, 1 billion is equivalent to 100 crores, i.e. 1 bn (1 b) = 1,000,000,000.

How many crores is 2 billion?

As we know. one billion equals hundred crores or ten thousand lakhs. Therefore, two hundred crores make 2 billion, i.e. 2 billion = 2 × 100 crores = 200 crores.

How many crores is 3.6 billion?

In the Indian numeral system, one billion is treated as one hundred (100) crores. Thus, 3.6 billion can be written as given below:

1 billion = 100 crores

3.6 billion = 3.6 × 100 crores = 360 crores

Therefore, 360 crores is 3.6 billion.

Triangular Pyramid Calculator is a free online tool that displays the surface area and the volume of the triangular pyramid. CoolGyan’S online triangular pyramid calculator tool performs the calculation faster and it displays the surface area and volume in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Triangular Pyramid Calculator?

Step 2: Now click the button “Calculate” to get the surface area and volume

Step 3: Finally, the surface area and the volume of a triangular pyramid will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by the Triangular Pyramid?

In geometry, a pyramid is defined as the three-dimensional figure with a triangular or square base, and faces of the pyramid meet at a common point called the apex. Based on the base of the pyramid, the pyramid can be classified into different types, such as the triangular pyramid, square pyramid, right pyramid, oblique pyramid and so on. A triangular pyramid is a pyramid, whose base and the faces of the pyramid are triangles. The formula to calculate the surface area and the volume of a triangular pyramid is given as:

The surface area of a triangular pyramid = Base area + [(3/2) × slant height × base length)] square units

The volume of a triangular pyramid, V = (⅓) × Base area × Height cubic units

Solved Example on Triangular Pyramid

Example 1:

Find the surface area and the volume of a triangular Pyramid whose side length is 4 cm, apothem length is 5 cm, slant height is 7 cm, and height is 6 cm.

Solution:

Given that, 

Side length = 4cm

Apothem length = 5 cm

Slant height =  7 cm

Height = 6 cm

Now substitute the values in the formula, we get

The surface area of a triangular pyramid = Base area + [(3/2) × slant height × base length)] square units

Base Area = (½)(4×5)

Base area = 20/2

Base area = 10 cm2.

Therefore, SA = 10 + [(3/2)(7)(4)]

SA = 10+ 14(3)

SA =10 + 42

SA = 52 cm2.

The volume of a triangular pyramid, V = (⅓) × Base area × Height cubic units

V = (⅓)  × 10 × 6

V = 10  × 2

V = 20 cm3.

What is Meant by Coulomb’s Law?

According to Coulomb’s law, the force of attraction or repulsion between two charged bodies is directly proportional to the product of their charges and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them. It acts along the line joining the two charges that are considered to be point charges. In other words, Coulomb’s law, or Coulomb’s inverse-square law, can be stated as an experimental law of physics that quantifies the amount of force between two stationary, electrically charged bodies or particles. The formula of Coulomb’s law is given as:
F = K[q1q2/d2] Here,
q1 = Charge of the first body
q2 = Charge of the second body
d = Distance between the two bodies
K = Electrostatic constant (approximately equal to 9 × 109)

Also, one of the simplest ways to find the factors of the quadratic equation is by using the quadratic formula. With the help of this formula, the roots of the equation are found. From those roots, the factors of the algebraic expression can be found.

data.post_headline: Rounding To The Nearest Thousandth Calculator
data.post_content:
Rounding To The Nearest Thousandth
Enter a Number

Rounded Number :

(to nearest thousandth)

 

Rounding to the nearest thousandth calculator is an online tool that will round off any value to its nearest thousandth. For example, if a number, say, 1002.45672 is entered, the calculator will round off the number to its nearest thousand and will give the result as 1002.457.  CoolGyan’S online rounding to the nearest thousandth calculator will round decimal numbers to their nearest thousandth value in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use Rounding To The Nearest Thousandth Calculator?

To use this calculator, follow the following steps

  • Step 1: Enter any decimal number in the first input box i.e. across “Enter a Number” text.
  • Step 2: Click the button “Solve” to get the rounded value
  • Step 3: Finally, the decimal number rounded to its nearest thousandth will be displayed in the output field.

What is Meant by Rounding to the Nearest Thousandth?

In Maths, the rounding of numbers means the trimming of numbers to the nearest place value. In the decimal number system, the numbers after the decimal points are defined as tenths (1/10), hundredths (1/100), thousandths (1/1000), and so on. Here, thousandth is a place, which is located at the third position after the decimal point. For example, 3.1678 is a decimal number. The thousandth digit of the given decimal number is 7. 

To round any decimal number to its nearest thousandth, follow the steps given below:

Let 7.1239 is a decimal number. Now, we have to round the given decimal number to its nearest thousandth.

Step 1: Identity the thousandth digit. (Here, 3 is the digit which is in thousandth place)

Step 2: Now, look at the digit, which is next to the thousandth place. If that digit is less than 5, round down the thousandth digit. If that digit is greater than or equal to 5, round up the thousandth digit. From the example given above, the digit next to the thousandth digit (i.e., 9) is greater than 5, so we have to round up the thousandth digit.

Step 3: Thus, the number 7.1239 rounded to the nearest thousandth is 7.124.

Frequently Asked Questions on Rounding to Nearest Thousandth

What is meant by rounding to the nearest thousandth?

The rounding of numbers to the nearest thousandth means rounding of any decimal numbers to its nearest thousandth value. In the decimal system, thousandth means (1/1000) or 0.001. For example, the number 3.1249 rounded to its nearest thousandth is 3.125.

Round 106.8724 to its nearest thousandth.

The number 106.8724 rounded to its nearest thousandth is 106.872, as the digit next to the thousandth digit is less than 5.

Round 34.67872 to its nearest thousandth.

The number 34.67872 rounded to the nearest thousandth is 34.679, as the digit next to the thousandth digit is greater than 5.

What is Meant by the Multiplying Mixed Fractions?

In Mathematics, the fraction represents the parts of a whole. The fraction can be classified into different types, namely proper fraction, improper fraction and a mixed fraction. The mixed fraction is a combination of a  whole number and a fraction. Like integer operations, we can perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division on mixed fractions. To perform multiplication of mixed numbers, follow the below procedure:

Step 1: Convert the mixed fraction into an improper fraction

Step 2: Multiply the numerator values and then the denominator values

Step 3: Finally simplify the expression or covert into the mixed number

For example, 2 ⅓  and 1 ½ are the mixed numbers

While converting the mixed numbers, we get 

2 ⅓ = 7/3

1 ½ = 3/2

Now, multiply the numerators and then the denominator values

= (7/3) (3/2)

= 21/6

Simplify the expression, and we get the product as 7/2.

Hence, the product of  2 ⅓  and 1 ½ is 7/2.

What is Multiplicative Inverse?

When a number is multiplied by its multiplicative inverse, it should be equal to 1. In other words, the multiplicative inverse of a number is another number, when its product is equal to 1. The multiplicative inverse is also known as “Reciprocal”.

Standard Formula

The standard form to represent the multiplicative inverse is as follows

If “n” is a number, then the multiplicative inverse or reciprocal of a number is “1/n”.

If a number is given in the fractional form “a/b”, then the multiplicative inverse is “b/a”.

Frequently Asked Questions on Multiplicative Inverse

What is meant by multiplicative inverse?

The multiplicative inverse means the reciprocal. If x is a number, then its multiplicative inverse is 1/x.

What is the multiplicative inverse of 3/4?

The multiplicative inverse of ¾ is 4/3 since the inverse of x is 1/x.

What is the multiplicative inverse of 0?

The multiplicative inverse of 0 is infinity. The number 0 does not have reciprocal because the product of any number and zero is equal to zero.

Proportion Calculator is a free online tool that displays whether the given proportions are equal or not. CoolGyan’S online proportion calculator tool makes the calculation faster, and it displays the true or false in a fraction of seconds.

How to Use the Proportion Calculator?

Step 2: Now click the button “Solve” to get the result

Step 3: Finally, the true or false for the given proportion will be displayed in the output field

What is Meant by Proportion?

In Mathematics, a proportion is defined as a statement that the two ratios should be equal. The symbols to represent the proportion are “::” or “=”. If p/q and r/s are two equal ratios, then we can write them in proportion as given below:

p/q = r/s

Or

p : q :: r : s

For example, 1/4 = 4/16. This can also be written in form 1:4 = 4:16. When two ratios are of equal value, then the values are in equal proportion. 

Also, read: Ratio and Proportion

From the above-given example, ¼ = 4/16 are in proportion, because, when the right-hand side is simplified, we get the ratio of the left-hand side. Then the proportion becomes 1:4 = 1:4.

Frequently Asked Questions on Proportion

What is proportion?

An equation that represents that the two given ratios are equivalent to each other is called a proportion.

Is proportion a type of ratio?

A proportion is an equation or equality of the two ratios, and we can write proportions to estimate equivalent ratios and work for unknown quantities.

What are the examples of proportion?

As we know, the proportion shows the equality of two ratios. Some of the examples of proportion are:
Example 1: 20 pens cost Rs. 100
40 pens cost Rs. 200
This can be expressed as: 20/100 = 40/200
Example 2: 5 drawing books contain a total of 50 pages.
8 drawing books contain a total of 80 pages.
This can be written as: 5/50 = 8/80
